data.description: Stars Collide as Meydan Hosts World Cup night preps The G2 Singspiel Stakes is the highlight of five Pattern races at Meydan Racecourse as the Dubai Racing Carnival hosts a fabulous Friday card.

<script id="jquery-js-after">
jQuery(function($) {

        function formatDateAndDay(dateString) {
            const options = { year: 'numeric', month: 'long', day: 'numeric' };
            const date = new Date(dateString);
            return {
                formattedDate: date.toLocaleDateString('en-GB', options),
                dayOfWeek: date.toLocaleDateString('en-GB', { weekday: 'long' }),
            };
        }

        const popup       = document.getElementById('race-popup');
        const closeBtn    = document.getElementById('close-popup');
        const raceDetails = document.getElementById('race-details');

        if (!popup || !closeBtn || !raceDetails) {
            console.warn('Popup elements not found on this page.');
            return;
        }

        // 🔹 Delegated click handler – works for dynamically added .open-popup
        $(document).on('click', '.open-popup', async function(e) {
            e.preventDefault();

            popup.style.display = 'block';
            raceDetails.innerHTML = `<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' width='24' height='24' viewBox='0 0 24 24'><path fill='currentColor' d='M12,23a9.63,9.63,0,0,1-8-9.5,9.51,9.51,0,0,1,6.79-9.1A1.66,1.66,0,0,0,12,2.81h0a1.67,1.67,0,0,0-1.94-1.64A11,11,0,0,0,12,23Z'><animateTransform attributeName='transform' dur='0.75s' repeatCount='indefinite' type='rotate' values='0 12 12;360 12 12'/></path></svg>`;

            const qDate = $(this).attr('data-date');
            const url   = $(this).attr('data-url');

            const { formattedDate, dayOfWeek } = formatDateAndDay(qDate);

            const ajaxUrl  = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php?action=fetch_race_details&date=' + qDate;
            const response = await fetch(ajaxUrl);
            let aloha      = await response.text();

            if (aloha) {
                console.log('Race details loaded');
            }

            raceDetails.innerHTML = `
                <p class='date-pop' id='date-poppp'>
                    <span>
                        <a href='' class='dsc-btn' style='margin-bottom: 20px;'>Show Meeting Results</a>
                    </span>
                </p>
                <div class='svganddate'>
                    <img decoding='async' src='/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/date_icon.svg'>
                    <p id='formattedaloa'></p>
                </div>
                <p id='day-pop'></p>
                <div id='aloha-container'>
                    <p>Loading race details...</p>
                </div>
            `;

            setTimeout(() => {
                document.getElementById('aloha-container').innerHTML = aloha;
                document.getElementById('day-pop').innerHTML        = dayOfWeek;
                document.getElementById('formattedaloa').innerHTML  = formattedDate;

                const link = document.querySelector('#date-poppp a');
                if (link) {
                    link.href = url;
                    link.textContent = 'Show Meeting Results';
                }
            }, 2000);
        });

}

.pp-section-right .quantity input.qty {

  font-size: 16px;
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
}

/* .quantity input.qty:focus {
    outline: none;
}
 */
/* Remove up/down arrows in number input for Chrome, Safari, Edge, and Opera */
.quantity input.qty::-webkit-outer-spin-button,

  -webkit-appearance: none;

</style>

<script>
jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
    // Wrap quantity input with custom quantity controls
    $('.quantity').each(function() {
        $(this).prepend('<button class="minus">-</button>');
        $(this).append('<button class="plus">+</button>');
    });

    // Increment quantity
    $('.plus').on('click', function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        var input = $(this).siblings('input.qty');
        var max = parseFloat(input.attr('max'));
        var step = parseFloat(input.attr('step'));
        var newVal = parseFloat(input.val()) + step;
        if (!max || newVal <= max) input.val(newVal).trigger('change');
    });

    // Decrement quantity
    $('.minus').on('click', function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        var input = $(this).siblings('input.qty');
        var min = parseFloat(input.attr('min'));
        var step = parseFloat(input.attr('step'));
        var newVal = parseFloat(input.val()) - step;
        if (!min || newVal >= min) input.val(newVal).trigger('change');
    });

});

	document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
    // Locate the specific category element to replace
    const allProductsCategory = document.querySelector("li.woof_term_52 .woof_label_term");

    if (allProductsCategory) {
        // Create a new button element
        const customButton = document.createElement("button");
        customButton.innerText = "All Products"; // Set the button text
        customButton.classList.add("custom-all-products-button"); // Add any custom classes

        // Set up the button click behavior to redirect
        customButton.addEventListener("click", function() {
            window.location.href = "https://dubairacingclub.com/shop/"; // Set your custom URL here
        });

        // Replace the category element with the custom button
        allProductsCategory.replaceWith(customButton);
    } else {
        console.error("All Products category element not found.");
    }
});

document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function () {
    var sortingSelect = document.querySelector('.woocommerce-ordering select.orderby');
    var firstOption = sortingSelect.querySelector('option:first-child');
    
    if (firstOption && firstOption.textContent.trim() === 'Default sorting') {
        firstOption.textContent = 'Sort by';
    }
});

jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
    // Override the button text after a variation is selected
    $(document).on('found_variation', function() {
        $('.add_to_cart_button').text('Buy Now');
    });

    // Set initial button text on page load
    $('.add_to_cart_button').text('Buy Now');
});

/* Wtach Live Starts */

#watchlive-button {
	background: #E60400;
	color: white;
	padding: 0px 15px;
	border-radius: 5px;
	cursor: pointer;
	z-index: 9999;
	width: 100%;
	height: 100%;
	display: flex;
	flex-direction: column;
	align-items: center;
	justify-content: center;
	gap: 10px;
	text-align: center;
	font-size: 14px;
	text-transform: uppercase;
	line-height: 16px;
	font-weight: 600;
	font-family: "Josefin Sans", Sans-serif;
}

#watchlive-sidebar h2 {
	text-align: center;
	font-size: 21px;
	text-transform: uppercase;
	line-height: 24px;
	font-weight: 600;
	font-family: "Josefin Sans", Sans-serif;
	color: #000;
	max-width: 154px;
	margin: 0 auto;
	padding-bottom: 24px;
	position: relative;
	margin-bottom: 21px;
}

#watchlive-sidebar h2:before {
	content: '';
	width: 71px;
	height: 5px;
	background: #028B4B;
	position: absolute;
	bottom: 0;
	left: 50%;
	transform: translate(-50%, 0px);
}

#watchlive-button img {
	width: 40px;
	height: 40px;
	border-radius: 50%;
}

.watchlive-code {
	position: fixed;
	right: 0px;
	top: 192px;
	color: white;
	border-top-left-radius: 10px;
	border-bottom-left-radius: 10px;
	cursor: pointer;
	z-index: 999;
	width: 79px;
	height: 160px;
	background: #E60400;
}

#watchlive-sidebar {
	position: fixed;
	right: -382px;
	top: 0;
	width: 382px;
	height: auto;
	background: #fff;
	box-shadow: -2px 0 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
	padding: 33px 22px 22px 22px;
	overflow-y: auto;
	transition: right 0.3s ease;
	z-index: 99999;
}

#watchlive-sidebar.active {
	right: 0;
}

.watchlive-content img {
	width: 100%;
	margin-bottom: 0px;
}

.watchlive-entry {
	margin-bottom: 20px;
	display: block;
}

.watchlive-extra-entry {
	margin-bottom: 15px;
	display: block;
}

.watchlive-code>.elementor-container.elementor-column-gap-no,
.watchlive-code>.elementor-container.elementor-column-gap-no .elementor-element,
.watchlive-code>.elementor-container.elementor-column-gap-no .elementor-shortcode,
.watchlive-code>.elementor-container.elementor-column-gap-no .elementor-element>.elementor-widget-container {
	height: 100%;
}

.watchlive-entry .watchlive-thumbnail:before {
	content: '';
	background-color: #0000004D;
	position: absolute;
	top: 0;
	left: 0;
	width: 100%;
	height: 100%;
	z-index: 9;
}

.watchlive-entry .watchlive-thumbnail {
	width: 100%;
	height: 100%;
	position: relative;
	display: block;
	cursor: pointer;
}

.watchlive-entry .watchlive-thumbnail:after {
	content: '';
	background-image: url(/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Group-371904.png);
	width: 74px;
	height: 74px;
	position: absolute;
	z-index: 9;
	top: 50%;
	left: 50%;
	transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
}

.watchlive-entry .watchlive-thumbnail p {
	position: absolute;
	background: #E60300;
	width: 159px;
	height: 33px;
	display: flex;
	align-items: center;
	justify-content: center;
	color: #fff;
	text-align: center;
	font-size: 12px;
	text-transform: uppercase;
	line-height: 14px;
	font-weight: 600;
	font-family: "Josefin Sans", Sans-serif;
	letter-spacing: 2px;
	bottom: 0;
	margin-bottom: 0;
	right: 0;
	z-index: 9;
}

button#watchlive-close-btn {
	position: absolute;
	top: 6px;
	right: 6px;
	width: 28px;
	height: 28px;
	padding: 0;
	border-radius: 50%;
	font-size: 13px;
	display: flex;
	align-items: center;
	justify-content: center;
	font-family: "Josefin Sans", Sans-serif;
	line-height: initial;
	font-weight: 700;
	background: #000;
	color: #fff;
	padding-top: 2px;
}

a.dsc-btn {
	font-family: "Josefin Sans", Sans-serif;
	font-size: 12px;
	font-weight: 400;
	text-transform: uppercase;
	line-height: 14px;
	letter-spacing: 2.4px;
	border: 1px solid #000;
	color: #000;
	padding: 12px 18px 10px 18px;
}

.watchlive-content p {
	color: #000;
	text-align: center;
}

}

}

}

												<figure class="wp-caption">
										<img fetchpriority="high" decoding="async" width="1920" height="1080" src="https://drcwebblob.blob.core.windows.net/drcwebmediacontent/2025/01/video.jpg.webp" class="attachment-full size-full wp-image-4992 wvs-archive-product-image" alt="" srcset="https://drcwebblob.blob.core.windows.net/drcwebmediacontent/2025/01/video.jpg.webp 1920w, https://drcwebblob.blob.core.windows.net/drcwebmediacontent/2025/01/video.jpg-647x364.webp 647w, https://dubairacingclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/video.jpg-300x169.webp 300w, https://dubairacingclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/video.jpg-1024x576.webp 1024w, https://dubairacingclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/video.jpg-768x432.webp 768w, https://dubairacingclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/video.jpg-1536x864.webp 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px">											<figcaption class="widget-image-caption wp-caption-text"></figcaption>
										</figure>

				</div>
				<div class="elementor-element elementor-element-74b3941 spost-cnt ob-harakiri-inherit ob-has-background-overlay elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor ob-harakiri" data-id="74b3941" data-element_type="widget" data-settings="{"_ob_use_harakiri":"yes","_ob_harakiri_writing_mode":"inherit","_ob_postman_use":"no","_ob_perspektive_use":"no","_ob_poopart_use":"yes","_ob_shadough_use":"no","_ob_allow_hoveranimator":"no","_ob_widget_stalker_use":"no"}" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
				<div class="elementor-widget-container">
									<div class="block block-layout-builder block-field-blocknodepress-releasesbody"><div class="block__content"><div class="text-content clearfix field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item"><p><strong>Stars Collide as Meydan Hosts World Cup night preps</strong></p><p>The G2 Singspiel Stakes is the highlight of five Pattern races at Meydan Racecourse as the Dubai Racing Carnival hosts a fabulous Friday card.</p><p>The 1800metre event, a prep for the G1 Dubai Turf over the same course and distance, was won last year by Valiant Prince<strong> </strong>and his trainer Charlie Appleby runs three, with stable jockey William Buick opting to partner <strong>Ottoman Fleet</strong>, second to stablemate Measured Time in the G1 Jebel Hatta last time out. Front runner <strong>Highland Avenue</strong> is the mount of Richie Mullen, with Mickael Barzalona on 2023 Jumeirah Classic winner <strong>Naval Power.</strong></p><p>“Ottoman Fleet probably brings the most consistent form over the course and distance into what looks a competitive race,” said Appleby. “It was always the plan to come here following a strong run in the Jebel Hatta.”</p><p>“Naval Power had a few minor setbacks last year but has been training well. This looks a nice starting point to see where we are before taking him back to Europe.</p><p>“Highland Avenue has a bit to find with Ottoman Fleet from the Jebel Hatta and Al Rashidiya but he is an honest performer and I am sure he will run his usual race.”</p><p>British trainer Jamie Osborne is already having a Carnival to remember thanks to Ouzo’s two wins and he runs <strong>Sean</strong>, a close second to Warren Point in the G3 Dubai Millennium Stakes three weeks’ ago.</p><p>“Sean has thrived during his stay in Dubai,” said Osborne. “I’m full of hope that we haven’t yet seen the best of him. It’s a very tough race and it will require a lifetime best, but I don’t think it’s impossible we will see one on Friday.”</p><p>Another British-based trainer who has been in the winner’s enclosure recently is Lucia Botti and she pitches in <strong>Royal Dubai</strong>, successful in a handicap two weeks’ ago.</p><p>“He seems to love to train on the dirt and he is improving with each race here in Dubai,” she said. “We are aware that this race is the most competitive of the Carnival, being the last over this similar distance, but Saeed Al Rahoomi [owner] wanted to take this step up in class after his game win last time.”</p><p><strong>Brits take on the Balanchine</strong></p><p>The G2 Balanchine, over the same 1800metres but for fillies and mares, has been won for the past six seasons by Godolphin. Appleby runs three, with Yarmouth Listed winner <strong>Sapphire Seas</strong> the pick of Buick. Barzalona rides Cape Verdi runner-up <strong>English Rose</strong>, with Mullen on <strong>Shining Jewel</strong>.</p><p>Appleby, who has won this race five times, made it clear who the first string is, telling Godolphin.com: “Sapphire Seas looks the filly they all have to beat. She was a good winner of a Listed race on her latest start. It’s her first appearance of the year but this will hopefully be a springboard to a nice European campaign.</p><p>“English Rose has definitely come forward since the Cape Verdi and I feel that she will appreciate racing over nine furlongs. Stepping back up in trip should suit Shining Jewel as well and we are applying a tongue-tie to her.”</p><p>Among those trying to break the Godolphin stranglehold is British trainer Hugo Palmer. He runs <strong>Stenton Glider</strong>, a good third in the Cape Verdi.</p><p>“We were very pleased with the run of Stenton Glider in the Cape Verdi,” said the Classic-winning trainer. “It was her first run since August, after the first real break she had in her life.</p><p>“The Cape Verdi and the Balanchine were always the plan when we came to Dubai. She is a maiden winner who has been placed in four Stakes races so she has the quality. She needs to keep plying her trade in Stakes company to become a Stakes winner, so the Balanchine was always going to be her second target.</p><p>“She does have a tentative entry in the [G1] Dubai Turf on World Cup night but she will have to win the Balanchine and win it well to go there.”</p><p><strong>Gold goes for Oaks Glory</strong></p><p>The last two winners of the G3 UAE Oaks have gone on to run in the G1 Kentucky Oaks, so eyes will be trained on <strong>Manama Gold</strong> to see if she follows the same path.</p><p>Fawzi Nass’s unbeaten filly, successful in the Cocoa Beach Stakes last time, faces five rivals in the 1900metre dirt contest and will be ridden by Adrie De Vries.</p><p>“She’s very exciting,” said the jockey. “She’s still improving and developing and came out of her last race really good. She was a bit long in her coat when she started here but she looks fantastic now.</p><p>“I think the further the better for her. She’s got a long stride and she’s very relaxed, so I’m not concerned about [the distance] at all.”</p><p>Among Manama Gold’s rivals are Doug Watson’s <strong>Mizzyaan</strong>, a good fourth on debut last time out despite missing the break.</p><p>Mizzyaan’s owner Sheikh Mohammed Bin Khalifa Al Maktoum also runs <strong>Auto Bahn</strong> in the Listed Al Bastakiya, race four, which is the second leg of the UAE Triple Crown and a prep for the G2 UAE Derby.</p><p>The Asiatic Boy colt was second to the re-opposing <strong>Falcon Of Arabia</strong> two weeks ago and is one of two in the race trained by Julio Olascoaga, who also sends out UAE 2000 Guineas third <strong>Quartier.</strong></p><p>“Both horses have shown in their previous starts enough quality to compete at the level of a Triple Crown in the UAE,” said the trainer. “We are happy and confident they’ll run a big race. They both arrive sound and in good condition, which we believe is key at this stage.”</p><p>Of Falcon Of Arabia, Managing Owner Paul Ebbs said: “He’s drawn in stall six and is a speedy type so he will find a prominent position. They key will be to campaign for the 1900 [metres] trip as it is unknown territory. His last run was over seven [furlongs, 1400metres] and the time was just short of the track record so he’s very versatile.</p><p>“The distance is a concern but as long as he stays he should be in the shake up.”</p><p><strong>Siskany’s bid for History</strong></p><p>Appleby has won the 2810metre G3 Nad Al Sheba Trophy, race seven, five times. However, his <strong>Siskany</strong> could make history if following up his 2023 win as no horse has won it twice.</p><p>“Siskany came out of the Al Khail Trophy well and his record around Meydan speaks for itself,” said Appleby of last year’s Dubai Gold Cup second. “We are hoping that he can produce another strong performance and book his ticket for the Dubai Gold Cup.”</p><p>Appleby also runs <strong>New London</strong>, whose career highlight to date is a second in the 2022 St Leger at Doncaster.</p><p>“New London has proved slightly disappointing lately,” he added. “We are applying cheek-pieces this time to hopefully produce a bit more encouragement.”</p><p>The all-Thoroughbred nine-race card begins at 5:30pm with a 1000metre turf handicap in which Simon and Ed Crisford’s <strong>Vespasian</strong>, winner over course and distance last month, looks a leading contender.</p></div></div></div>								</div>
				</div>
					</div>
		</div>

	<div id="popmake-4495" class="pum-container popmake theme-4486 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium">

				
				
		
				<div class="pum-content popmake-content" tabindex="0">
			<p>Horseracing began in Dubai in October 1981, when the Camel Track hosted the first Thoroughbred race meeting. Three races were run – over a sprint distance, a mile and a mile and a half – organised by the office of His Highness Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Vice President and Prime Minister of the UAE and Ruler of Dubai. Approximately 10 years later, in early 1992, the Dubai Racing Club was established under the chairmanship of Colonel Ali Khamis Al Jafleh, a UAE Air Force commander. In March 1992 came the official opening at Nad Al Sheba Racecourse, where the highlight was the appearance of some of horseracing’s biggest stars at the time – jockeys Lester Piggott and Willie Carson. A year later, in March 1993, with limitations on the free movement of horses shipping in and out of the UAE, the Dubai Racing Club selected the next-best option, jockeys. On 26 March that year, Nad Al Sheba Racecourse hosted the inaugural Dubai International Jockeys’ Challenge (DIJC). Five groups of two jockeys were invited to compete, with senior riders representing the USA, Europe, Australia, Japan and the United Arab Emirates.</p>
<p>The DIJC would eventually pave the way for the creation of the Dubai World Cup. The first Dubai World Cup was held in 1996 and thrust both Nad Al Sheba Racecourse and the UAE onto the global stage as American wonder horse Cigar claimed the inaugural running. It was at the event’s 14th running in 2009 that another American brilliantly bookmarked the Dubai World Cup and brought to an end the chapter at Nad Al Sheba Racecourse. Well Armed romped to a 14-length success, a record-winning distance, to herald the end of the Nad Al Sheba era.</p>
<p>The next Dubai World Cup, in 2010, introduced the iconic Meydan Grandstand and Racecourse to the world. The architectural masterpiece is the permanent home for the Dubai World Cup and is the world’s largest integrated racing facility, with a Grandstand seating capacity for more than 60,000. The spectacular structure sits alongside The Meydan Hotel which boasts 285 elegantly appointed rooms and suites.</p>
<p>The excitement of the first Dubai World Cup hosted at Meydan was equaled on the track that year as Gloria de Campeão emerged the winner in an exciting three-horse finish to become the event’s first Brazilian-bred champion.</p>
<p>In 2011, Victoire Pisa and Transcend gave Japan a first win and a one – two finish in the coveted race and in 2012 Godolphin repeated the feat with Monterosso in first and Capponi in second.</p>
<p>Fast forward to 2017 and the USA was once again successful when world champion Arrogate stunned the crowd and millions watching overseas with an impossible last-to-first victory.  The Saeed bin Suroor-trained, Godolphin–owned Thunder Snow then created history by becoming the first horse to win the Dubai World Cup twice, with victories in 2018 and 2019.</p>
<p>Godolphin’s American based Mystic Guide, trained by Michael Stidham, gave a brilliant performance in the 25th running of the Dubai World Cup in 2021, as he roared home in impressive style, a year before Country Grammer made it two in a row for America.</p>
<p>In 2023, the great race went to Japan for a second time, with Ushba Tesoro taking the trophy while in 2024 more history was made when Laurel River, trained by Bhupat Seemar and ridden by Tadhg O’Shea, became the first locally-trained winner of the race, outside of the Godolphin operation.</p>
		</div>

			<script>
				const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
			</script>

jQuery(document).ready(function(){
	
	 jQuery('.calendar-tabs ul li').on('click', function() {
        jQuery('.calendar-tabs ul li').removeClass('active');
        
        jQuery(this).addClass('active');
    });
	
	 jQuery(".spost-date li.elementor-icon-list-item.elementor-inline-item:last-child span.elementor-icon-list-text").each(function() {
        if (jQuery.trim(jQuery(this).text()) === "") {
            jQuery(this).closest("li.elementor-icon-list-item").hide();
        }
    });
	
         var watchLiveButton = jQuery('#watchlive-button');
var watchLiveSidebar = jQuery('#watchlive-sidebar');
var closeBtn = jQuery('#watchlive-close-btn');

// Toggle the sidebar when the button is clicked
watchLiveButton.on('click', function(event) {
    event.stopPropagation(); // Prevent the click event from propagating to the document
    watchLiveSidebar.toggleClass('active');
});

// Close the sidebar when the close button (X) is clicked
closeBtn.on('click', function(event) {
    event.stopPropagation(); // Prevent the event from bubbling up
    watchLiveSidebar.removeClass('active');
});

// Close the sidebar if the user clicks outside of it
jQuery(document).on('click', function(event) {
    if (!watchLiveSidebar.is(event.target) && watchLiveSidebar.has(event.target).length === 0 && !watchLiveButton.is(event.target)) {
        watchLiveSidebar.removeClass('active');
    }
});

// Prevent the sidebar from closing if clicked inside the sidebar
watchLiveSidebar.on('click', function(event) {
    event.stopPropagation(); // Prevent click from closing the sidebar
});

	
	jQuery('.rrnumbers').on('click', function() {
        // Remove "active" class from all <li> and <div> elements
        jQuery('.rrnumbers').removeClass('active');
        jQuery('.rrcontent').removeClass('active');

        // Add "active" class to clicked <li> and corresponding <div>
        jQuery(this).addClass('active');
        var target = jQuery(this).data('target');
        jQuery('#' + target).addClass('active');
    });

jQuery('.med1').on('click', function() {
    // Show the latest videos slider and hide the race highlights slider
    jQuery('.media-latest-slide').show();
    jQuery('.media-race-slide').hide();
    
    // Toggle active class on the tabs
    jQuery('.med1').addClass('active'); 
    jQuery('.med2').removeClass('active'); 
    
    // Refresh the Slick slider
    jQuery('.media-latest-slide .elementor-shortcode').slick('setPosition');
    
    // Set opacity to 1 for .media-inn2 and refresh its content
    jQuery('.media-inn2').css('opacity', '0').animate({ opacity: 1 }, 300);
});

jQuery('.med2').on('click', function() {
    // Show the race highlights slider and hide the latest videos slider
    jQuery('.media-race-slide').show();
    jQuery('.media-latest-slide').hide();
    
    // Toggle active class on the tabs
    jQuery('.med2').addClass('active');
    jQuery('.med1').removeClass('active');
    
    // Refresh the Slick slider
    jQuery('.media-race-slide .elementor-shortcode').slick('setPosition');
    
    // Set opacity to 1 for .media-inn2 and refresh its content

<script>
	document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function () {
  // Pattern to match "31 January 2025" or "31 January 2025"
  const datePattern = /\b(?:Monday|Tuesday|Wednesday|Thursday|Friday|Saturday|Sunday)?\s*(\d{1,2})\s+(January|February|March|April|May|June|July|August|September|October|November|December)\s+(\d{4})\b/gi;

  function replaceDatesInNode(node) {
    if (node.nodeType === Node.TEXT_NODE && datePattern.test(node.textContent)) {
      node.textContent = node.textContent.replace(datePattern, (_, day, month, year) => {
        return `${day} ${month} ${year}`;
      });
    } else if (node.nodeType === Node.ELEMENT_NODE) {
      node.childNodes.forEach(replaceDatesInNode);
    }
  }

  replaceDatesInNode(document.body);
});
</script>

<script>
document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function () {
  const monthMap = {
    Jan: "January",
    Feb: "February",
    Mar: "March",
    Apr: "April",
    May: "May",
    Jun: "June",
    Jul: "July",
    Aug: "August",
    Sep: "September",
    Oct: "October",
    Nov: "November",
    Dec: "December"
  };

  document.querySelectorAll(".n-hours").forEach(el => {
    const text = el.textContent.trim();

    // Match formats like "29 Mar 2025"
    const match = text.match(/(\d{1,2})\s([A-Za-z]{3})\s(\d{4})/);
    if (match) {
      const [, day, shortMonth, year] = match;
      const fullMonth = monthMap[shortMonth];
      if (fullMonth) {
        el.innerHTML = el.innerHTML.replace(`${day} ${shortMonth} ${year}`, `${day} ${fullMonth} ${year}`);
      }
    }
  });
});
</script>

<script>
	jQuery(document).ready(function(jQuery) {
    jQuery('.events-item .left-read a').on('click', function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();

        var eventItem = jQuery(this).closest('.events-item'); // current container
        var desc = eventItem.find('.left-desc');              // target description
        var button = jQuery(this);

        // Close all others
        jQuery('.events-item').not(eventItem).each(function() {
            jQuery(this).find('.left-desc').removeClass('open');
            jQuery(this).find('.left-read a').text('Read more');
        });

        // Toggle current
        desc.toggleClass('open');
        button.text(desc.hasClass('open') ? 'Read less' : 'Read more');
    });
});
</script>
